title: Does writing something in the chatbox under a report even do anything?
body: Since the whole system is automated, does it even matter what I type there?

replies.body:
The system is not entirely automated, it goes to a human employee for review in some cases.

Anything above a chat restriction has to be reviewed.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-03-27T00:42:28.964+0000)
>
> The system is not entirely automated, it goes to a human employee for review in some cases.
> 
> Anything above a chat restriction has to be reviewed.

Not quite.  All cases are on the automatic system.  But sometimes a player skates just below the line, gameplay trolls, or ask for clarification via a support ticket.  Comments help for manual reviews in those cases.

> [{quoted}](name=AJStarhiker,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T00:48:45.953+0000)
>
> Not quite.  All cases are on the automatic system.  But sometimes a player skates just below the line, gameplay trolls, or ask for clarification via a support ticket.  Comments help for manual reviews in those cases.

Anything above a restriction is manually reviewed.

Riot has stated this quite a few times, and the feedback always shows manual review and by whom.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T00:50:19.327+0000)
>
> Anything above a restriction is manually reviewed.
> 
> Riot has stated this quite a few times, and the feedback always shows manual review and by whom.

That was the old system, before and while calibrating the current one.

> [{quoted}](name=AJStarhiker,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T00:58:44.681+0000)
>
> That was the old system, before and while calibrating the current one.

Still true as of roughly 3 days ago.

Removing any human verification from bans would be a disaster, regardless.
pretty sure there is no human verification at all anymore unless there is an appeal

> [{quoted}](name=EL HAMSTERO,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2018-03-27T08:11:35.260+0000)
>
> pretty sure there is no human verification at all anymore unless there is an appeal

pretty sure you are wrong.

Unless riot is both lying and going well out of their way to fake it, plus making the system incredibly good at understanding context and complex human interaction, which would make riot games the world leader in the interactive AI field.
i believe you mistaken.  do you have any link to back up your claims?

> [{quoted}](name=EL HAMSTERO,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=00000000000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T21:08:18.717+0000)
>
> i believe you mistaken.  do you have any link to back up your claims?

I just listed proof for my 'claims'.

That should be enough, if you are capable of logical thought and not simply a troll looking for petty arguments and attention.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=000000000000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T21:11:45.427+0000)
>
> I just listed proof for my 'claims'.
> 
> That should be enough, if you are capable of logical thought and not simply a troll looking for petty arguments and attention.

Yeeesh, he just wants a citation lol. I was hoping for one too myself, just so I know for sure instead of basing it on trust and old information. Not a big deal, just was hoping while I'm here.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=000000000000000000000001000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T21:11:45.427+0000)
>
> I just listed proof for my 'claims'.
> 
> That should be enough, if you are capable of logical thought and not simply a troll looking for petty arguments and attention.

You haven't listed any proof.  Just your speculation.  We're talking about a post from a Rioter about the *current* behavior system.

> [{quoted}](name=AJStarhiker,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=0000000000000000000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T21:24:03.593+0000)
>
> You haven't listed any proof.  Just your speculation.  We're talking about a post from a Rioter about the *current* behavior system.

So none of the previous ones are valid?

I am sure you would find a way to disregard one from the last 24 hours as well, but since riot expects people to be smart instead of pedantic, they only post updates every 6 months or so.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=00000000000000000000000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T21:27:22.843+0000)
>
> So none of the previous ones are valid?
> 
> I am sure you would find a way to disregard one from the last 24 hours as well, but since riot expects people to be smart instead of pedantic, they only post updates every 6 months or so.

If you find one from a few years ago, then yes, it would say that all permas are done manually.  If you find one from Tribunal, you might see posts about report weight.  Or far enough back, posts about IP rewards for voting correctly.  So no, previous systems don't automatically apply to the current one.

> [{quoted}](name=AJStarhiker,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=000000000000000000000001000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T21:45:11.338+0000)
>
> If you find one from a few years ago, then yes, it would say that all permas are done manually.  If you find one from Tribunal, you might see posts about report weight.  Or far enough back, posts about IP rewards for voting correctly.  So no, previous systems don't automatically apply to the current one.

So you are suggestion the entire system has been changed with riot developing an AI that can fool everyone into believing it is a real human being in interaction _and_ understand context, correctly identify trolling/inting, all in the last year, and they never bothered to tell anyone?

This is how religions are formed.

> [{quoted}](name=AJStarhiker,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=00000000000000000000000100000000000000000000000000000002,timestamp=2018-03-28T01:07:43.339+0000)
>
> Of course I'm not there.  I'm right where I am.
> 
> Seriously, though, if Riot had an AI, the bots in Co-op wouldn't be nearly as easy as they are.  Even Doombots are pretty stupid and predictable, they just have all their abilities amped up.

AI for evaluating player behavior is incredibly different and far simpler from AI for playing a complex game in real time.

The first is probably using a simple neural net over some basic programmed filters, the second is a ton of hand-written rules and choices that have to be fine-tuned to run nearly instantly. Training a neural network for that would take thousands of games, and it would not run well in real time, or use an acceptable amount of resources.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=00000000000000000000000100000000000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2018-03-27T23:57:56.381+0000)
>
> Because your entire mindset on this is "NANANANA I CANT HERE YOU".
> 
> And you just _defined_ an AI, not to mention the machine learning is pretty rudimentary right now.

Of course I'm not there.  I'm right where I am.

Seriously, though, if Riot had an AI, the bots in Co-op wouldn't be nearly as easy as they are.  Even Doombots are pretty stupid and predictable, they just have all their abilities amped up.

> [{quoted}](name=AJStarhiker,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=00000000000000000000000100000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T23:37:50.745+0000)
>
> And I'm not quite sure how you jumped from that to the formation of religions.

Because your entire mindset on this is "NANANANA I CANT HERE YOU".

And you just _defined_ an AI, not to mention the machine learning is pretty rudimentary right now.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=0000000000000000000000010000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T22:07:01.257+0000)
>
> So you are suggestion the entire system has been changed with riot developing an AI that can fool everyone into believing it is a real human being in interaction _and_ understand context, correctly identify trolling/inting, all in the last year, and they never bothered to tell anyone?
> 
> This is how religions are formed.

No, I'm saying information about the system that used to be accurate at the time may no longer be accurate to how the current system works.

The programming for the behavior analysis isn't an AI.  It's a dedicated program that uses machine learning based on existing data and large-scale reporting trends.  It doesn't interact with players beyond sending IFS chat logs and (occassionally) a "Player was punished" notice.

And I'm not quite sure how you jumped from that to the formation of religions.

im actually interested.  i would be surprised and pleased if you are right.  can you show me an example of where riot says that permanent bans are all reviewed by humans?  

from what i have seen the punishments do not take context into consideration at all.

> [{quoted}](name=EL HAMSTERO,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=0000000000000000000000010000000000000001,timestamp=2018-03-27T21:26:49.491+0000)
>
> im actually interested.  i would be surprised and pleased if you are right.  can you show me an example of where riot says that permanent bans are all reviewed by humans?  
> 
> from what i have seen the punishments do not take context into consideration at all.

I think you have to go back to the rolling chat bans to find any "all permas are done manually".  By the time Riot started the autopermas, they had several years and millions of games' worth of data to figure out at what point giving "one more chance" no longer worked.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T01:02:41.837+0000)
>
> Still true as of roughly 3 days ago.
> 
> Removing any human verification from bans would be a disaster, regardless.

Can you show a link?  Because last I heard, manual reviews are only on edge cases or on request from the banned player.  Or if they do a manual audit to spot check the system's accuracy.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=NnO0WpjB,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-27T00:50:19.327+0000)
>
> Anything above a restriction is manually reviewed.


That's not true.

in case a human review happens (lol gl on that one) your comment may be usefull.
tbh i have no idea how many manual reviews happen on a daily basis so i cant say much, but i seriously dont feel like writing anything into the reports
unless its someone who trolls in a special way that you might not directly see.

It's not entirely automated, but I don't know for sure how much descriptions help. I always leave a description, but quite frankly, I don't know if it helps or not. I'm surprised there's so many posts here, but not one from Riot. Was hoping they would give a definitive answer.
a lot of reports get manually reviewed if they are reported by multiple people but the system doesn't get tripped, so yes

Before the IFS, I would take screen shots because player support previously couldn't see pre-game or post-game chat and I would host it on some site like imgur or something and post the link for the box. Now that IFS scans all of it, for chat related offenses, I don't bother any explanations. I just check off the appropriate boxes and report and move on.

Now for gameplay reports like inting or trolling, I do type it to point out certain time frames or descriptions of events where I distinctly remember toxic gameplay behavior so that player behavior specialists can take a good look at specific times and try to find a better way to detect the troll behavior.

I honestly have no idea if player behavior specialists do read the comments, but I do it anyway just in case they do.

For automated punishments, it likely doesn't do much. However, in the event of manual reviews, I feel like they play a much larger role.

Although, if a person was reported multiple times with the note "Post game" or "Pre-game" and referenced chat, I'd think the automated system may play a role there. Just conjecture, I suppose.
Yes.  Sometimes a report is borderline punishable.  Comments help if a manual review is needed.
